prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and bottom. 1. Define a new coordinate system with no rotation and a translation vector of (0, 0, 0.1172). 2. Create the first sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. a. Draw the first loop using a circle with a center at (0.0938, 0.0938) and a radius of 0.0938. b. Draw the second loop using a circle with a center at (0.0938, 0.0938) and a radius of 0.0727. 3. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.1875. 4. Extrude the scaled sketch up to a depth of 0.5156 towards the normal vector. Use the "NewBodyFeatureOperation" to create a new solid body. Part 2: Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered end resembling a metallic tube or pipe. 1. Define a new coordinate system with no rotation and a translation vector of (0.0211, 0.0211, 0.1172). This coordinate system should be based on the first part. 2. Create the sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. a. Draw the loop using a circle with a center at (0.0727, 0.0727) and a radius of 0.0727. 3. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.1453. 4. Extrude the scaled sketch up to a depth of 0.6328 towards the normal vector using the "JoinFeatureOperation". Part 3: Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly curved side. 1. Use the same coordinate system and sketch as Part 2. 2. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.1453. 3. Extrude the scaled sketch to a depth of 0.1172 in the opposite direction of the normal vector using the "JoinFeatureOperation". Part 4: Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered end resembling a metallic tube or pipe. 1. Define a new coordinate system with a rotation of (-90, 0, -90) and a translation vector of (0.0938, 0.0469, 0.3281). This coordinate system should be based on the final shape. 2. Create the first sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. a. Draw the first loop using a line segment from (0.0469, 0) to (0.0469, 0.0938), followed by an arc starting at (0.0469, 0.0938), having a midpoint at (0.0, 0.0469), and ending at (0.0469, 0.0). b. Draw the second loop using a line segment from (0.0469, 0) to (0.0469, 0.0938), followed by an arc starting at (0.0469, 0.0938), having a midpoint at (0.0938, 0.0469), and ending at (0.0469, 0.0). 3. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.0938. 4. Extrude the scaled sketch up to a depth of 0.5859 towards the normal vector using the "CutFeatureOperation".</description>
